_plugin.description: The name of the plugin to use.

basic-auth-only.description: Force basic authentication. This option is only available when using SSL.

cacert.description: The path to the CA certificate.

connect-timeout.description: How long to wait in seconds when establishing connections.

copy-command.description: Array of command and flags to use when copying files using ssh-command. Bolt runs `<copy-command> <src> <dest>`.

disconnect-timeout.description: How long to wait in seconds before force-closing a connection.

encryption-algorithms.description: List of encryption algorithms to use when establishing a connection with a target. Supported algorithms are defined by the Ruby net-ssh library and can be viewed at https://github.com/net-ssh/net-ssh#supported-algorithms . All supported, non-deprecated algorithms are available by default when this option is not used. To reference all default algorithms when using this option, add 'defaults' to the list of supported algorithms.

cleanup.description: Whether to clean up temporary files created on targets.

extensions.description: A list of file extensions that are accepted for scripts or tasks.

file-protocol.description: Which file transfer protocol to use. 'smb' is recommended for large file transfers.

host-key-algorithms.description: List of host key algorithms to use when establishing a connection with a target. Supported algorithms are defined by the Ruby net-ssh library and can be viewed at https://github.com/net-ssh/net-ssh#supported-algorithms . All supported, non-deprecated algorithms are available by default when this option is not used. To reference all default algorithms when using this option, add 'defaults' to the list of supported algorithms.

host-key-check.description: Whether to perform host key validation when connecting.

interpreters.description: A map of extension names to the absolute path of an executable, enabling you to override the shebang defined in a task executable.

job-poll-interval.description: The interval to poll orchestrator for job status.

job-poll-timeout.description: The time to wait for orchestrator job status.

kex-algorithms.description: List of key exchange algorithms to use when establishing a connection with a target. Supported algorithms are defined by the Ruby net-ssh library and can be viewed at https://github.com/net-ssh/net-ssh#supported-algorithms . All supported, non-deprecated algorithms are available by default when this option is not used. To reference all default algorithms when using this option, add 'defaults' to the list of supported algorithms.

load-config.description: Whether to load system SSH configuration.

login-shell.description: Which login shell Bolt should expect on the target.

mac-algorithms.description: List of message authentication code algorithms to use when establishing a connection with a target. Supported algorithms are defined by the Ruby net-ssh library and can be viewed at https://github.com/net-ssh/net-ssh#supported-algorithms . All supported, non-deprecated algorithms are available by default when this option is not used. To reference all default algorithms when using this option, add 'defaults' to the list of supported algorithms.

private-key.description: Either the path to the private key file to use for authentication, or a hash with the key 'key-data' and the contents of the private key.

proxyjump.description: A jump host to proxy connections through, and an optional user to connect with.

realm.description: Kerberos realm (Active Directory domain) to authenticate against.

run-as.description: The user to run commands as after login.

run-as-command.description: The command to elevate permissions. Bolt appends the user and command strings to the configured 'run-as-command' before running it on the target.

run-on.description: The proxy target that the task executes on.

script-dir.description: The subdirectory of the tmpdir to use in place of a randomized subdirectory for uploading and executing temporary fileson the target.

service-url.description: URL of the host used for API requests.

shell-command.description: A shell command to wrap any Docker exec commands in, such as `bash -lc`.

smb-port.description: The port to establish a connection on when using the smb file protocol.

ssh-command.description: Array of command and flags to use when SSHing. This enables the external SSH transport which shells out to the specified command.

ssl.description: Whether to use a secure https connection.

ssl-verify.description: Whether to verify the target certificate matches the cacert.

sudo-executable.description: The executable to use when escalating to the configured 'run-as' user.

sudo-password.description: The password to use when changing users via 'run-as'.

task-environment.description: The environment the orchestrator loads task code from

tmpdir.description: The directory to upload and execute temporary files on the target.

token-file.description: The path to the token file.

tty.description: Whether to enable tty on exec commands.
